ja405:0.1_0: The group of twelve on “as expected”
ja405:1.1_0: “Gotama, we seventy-two merit-makers are now wielders of power,
ja405:1.2_0: having passed beyond rebirth and old age.
ja405:1.3_0: This is our last rebirth, knowledge-master.
ja405:1.4_0: And now many people pray to us.”
ja405:11.3_0: Another on the side of the ear,
ja405:2.1_0: “But, Baka, the life span here is short, not long,
ja405:2.2_0: the do you think, Dīgha Tapassī!
ja405:3.1_0: “Blessed One, I am the one of infinite vision,
ja405:3.2_0: who has gone beyond rebirth and old age and sorrow.
ja405:3.3_0: What precepts and observances did I practice in the past?
ja405:3.4_0: Explain to me so I can understand.”
ja405:4.2_0: who were oppressed by thirst and heat.
ja405:4.3_0: They’re the precepts and observances you practiced in the past.
ja405:4.4_0: I recollect it like one who has wakened from sleep.
ja405:5.1_0: When people at Deer River Bank were seized,
ja405:5.2_0: you released the captives as they were led away.
ja405:5.3_0: They’re the precepts and observances you practiced in the past.
ja405:5.4_0: I recollect it like one who has wakened from sleep.
ja405:6.1_0: When a boat on the Ganges River was seized
ja405:6.2_0: by a fierce dragon desiring human flesh,
ja405:6.3_0: you freed it wielding mighty force.
ja405:6.4_0: That’s the precepts and observances you practiced in the past.
ja405:6.5_0: I recollect it like one who has wakened from sleep.
ja405:7.1_0: I used to be your servant named Kappa.
ja405:7.3_0: They’re the precepts and observances you practiced in the past.
ja405:7.4_0: I recollect it like one who has wakened from sleep.”
ja405:8.1_0: “You certainly understand this life span of mine.
ja405:8.2_0: for you must know the Buddha,
ja405:8.4_0: lights up even the Brahmā realm.”
ja405:9.1_0: The tenth sub-chapter on armpits is finished.
ja405:9.2_0: The first sub-chapter on dogs is finished.
